To build scalable tech that ensures every Indian, in every language, gets access to the right information and creative platforms.

We are pleased to share that the Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between IKP Knowledge Park and ACCESS Health International (AHI) was exchanged on July 18, 2025, at The Narayanan Vaghul Building, IKP Park Office, Genome Valley, Hyderabad.

This collaboration marks a significant milestone in advancing healthcare innovation and technology transfer between India and Egypt, with a focus on:

üîπ Innovation scouting, IP strategy, and cross-border commercialization
üîπ Localisation and regulatory alignment for biosimilars, oncology, vaccines, and immunosuppressants
üîπ Supporting Egypt‚Äôs national direction to localise Active Pharmaceutical Ingredients (APIs) and Intermediates (IPIs)

This partnership is set to enable joint IP services, regulatory capacity building, innovation scouting, and global market access for startups and researchers. It cements a new bridge between Indian and Egyptian innovation ecosystems, working together to deliver global impact in life sciences and public health. 

#InnovationPartnership #HealthcareInnovation #GlobalCollaboration #IndoEgyptPartnership #LifeSciences

Driving India‚Äôs Scientific Leadership Towards 2047 

At the Joint Review of Science Ministries, Hon‚Äôble Minister Dr. Jitendra Singh spotlighted the #BioE3 Policy as a key driver for biomanufacturing, green growth, and employment generation. The review assessed cross-sectoral scientific initiatives and called for outcome-based coordination across departments in line with India‚Äôs Vision 2047 goals.

BRIC DBT

BIRAC participated in "Hack4Health", organised by IIITD Innovation & Incubation Center. The event aimed to empower student innovators to take their first steps toward developing impactful, viable and scalable Deep tech healthcare solutions

Dr. Sonali Tandon, BIRAC participated in the panel discussion "Growing Importance of AI in Healthcare: Are We Ready for It?" along with Dr. Dr. Vinish Kathuria (Partner, SenseAI Ventures, Co-founder Rank Software Inc, Investor), Dr. Bharat Aggarwal (Principal Director, Radiology, Max Healthcare), Prof. Neetu Singh (Head, CBME, IIT Delhi) and Rajeev Gautam (President, HORIBA India)

The panel discussion centred on the increasing importance and benefits of AI in healthcare, as well as the challenges and opportunities in this field. Dr. Sonali Tandon highlighted the role of BIRAC and DBT in enabling India's biotechnology ecosystem to embrace the wave of AI and how aspiring entrepreneurs can benefit from it.

#Hack4Health #PanelDiscussion #Biotechnology #Challenges #AI #NewAgeHealthcare

#TechnologyforLicensing: Plasma Clean, a novel air purification plus decontamination technology.  

The solution addresses the limitations of the existing technologies for air purification and is capable of: 
*Neutralising pathogens  
*Trapping/removing PM2.5 & PM10 particles 
*Faster disinfection and purification of air covering the entire range of pollutants, pathogens, SPM and VoCs 

Advantages of design:  
*Validated on the ESKAPE range of bacterial pathogens, fungal pathogens & viral organisms  
*Can be customised as a stand-alone as well as an attachment with existing filtration devices & AHU systems
*Scalable as the cartridge is modular and the product can be scaled for the application area

Interested in knowing more? 
Please get in touch with the CCAMP Office of Technology Transfer (#OTT): 
ott@ccamp.res.in, dia_licensing@ccamp.res.in 
080 6718 5322

The CCAMP One Health AMR Challenge 2025, supported by The International Centre for Antimicrobial Resistance Solutions (ICARS), is here!

Launched at the India AMR Innovation Workshop in the presence of Prof. Ajay Sood, Principal Scientific Adviser to GoI, (Office of the Principal Scientific Adviser to the Government of India) this challenge is a huge opportunity for innovators across the world working in the #antimicrobialresistance space!

What's in for AMR innovators:
üåüFinancial support - in the range of USD 50K- USD 250K, (‚Çπ40 lacs - ‚Çπ 2 crores), for mid-to-late-stage AMR innovations
üåüTechnical support and mentorship on regulatory affairs, legal, IP, manufacturing, market strategies and readiness, scale-up and much more!
üåüValidation studies through pilot deployments

üåü Congratulations to Deep Algorithms Solutions on raising ‚Çπ10.8 Cr (approx. $1.25M) in Seed Funding led by Unicorn India Ventures! üåü

We are proud to share that Deep Algorithms Solutions, one of our incubated portfolio startups at IIT Mandi Catalyst, has successfully raised ‚Çπ10.8 crore ($1.25 million) in a seed funding round led by Unicorn India Ventures, with participation from several esteemed angel investors.

Founded by J P Mishra in December 2021, Deep Algorithms Solutions is a pioneering behavioral cybersecurity and AI startup committed to tackling sophisticated cyber fraud. The startup leverages indigenous AI and behavioral intelligence to address critical challenges in digital identity security and real-time application protection.

This milestone funding reinforces confidence in their vision and the impactful problem they are solving ‚Äî Identity Security and Real-Time Application Security powered by AI and Behavioral Intelligence.

üí• More power to the team as they continue to innovate and protect the digital world!

Society for Innovation & Entrepreneurship -SINE IIT Bombay is pleased to host NCIIPC India (A unit of NTRO) and Startup India (DPIIT)¬†for an exclusive invite only¬†interaction on the¬†NCIIPC Startup India AI Grand Challenge 2025.

Based on the theme ‚ÄúResponsible AI for National Security‚Äù, the interactive session will offer valuable¬†insights into the challenge, its goals, and the exciting opportunities it presents for startups working at¬†the intersection of AI and national security priorities.

Key Focus Areas:

1. Code Vulnerability and Threat Detection 
2. Signal Processing
3. Domain Awareness
4. Geospatial Technologies
5. Cryptology and Forensics
6. Intelligent Document Understanding and RAG

SIDBI(Small Industries Development Bank of India) and Society for Innovation & Entrepreneurship -SINE IIT Bombay today hosted a thought-provoking brainstorming session on "Strengthening Investment Capabilities of Incubators."ü§ù

Key highlights of the sessions:
-Investment experience sharing by SIDBI-backed incubators.
-Building an investment offering at the University/Institutions level.
-Building a fund housed at the incubator
-Panel Discussion: How to build funds for success and attract capital?
-Incubating a collaborative platform to set up and support a university-housed VC fund in India.

Several insights and suggestions were shared by the speakers during the session. The highlight of the day was SIDBI's commitment to build investment capabilities at incubator level across India.

The deliberations sparked compelling ideas on establishing university-linked venture capital funds which can be¬†transformative for India‚Äôs innovation landscape and entrepreneurial ecosystem.

üöÄ¬† And that‚Äôs a wrap on Launchpad 28! 

As a part of our end reviews, we brought together the cohort for 2 days packed with insights and action!¬† 

Joining us at this engagement were our speakers:¬† 

Dr. Rajashree SR, Consultant, Ministry of education, Govt of India and Founder and director, VYOMA Artspace and Studio Theatre 
 
Nagaraja (Naga) Prakasam , Mentor in Residence,¬† NSRCEL and Partner, Acumen

From tapping into sessions that went deep into Performing Pitches, Community-led Growth, Fundraising and Grant Opportunities, this cohort has been all about turning its ideas and prototype into action. 

This engagement ended with End-Review Pitches that our startups presented to a panel of NSRCEL mentors - industry experts and the team at NSRCEL - all while building a community that learns, shares, and grows together! 

A big thank you to our speakers for being a part of this engagement! Wishing you all the best for all that‚Äôs coming your way!

A Fireside Chat with the Founder of Akshayakalpa!

As part of the Impact Orbit- Tech-Enabled Social Innovations, an initiative by Capgemini, a fireside chat featured Shashi Kumar, Founder and CEO of Akshayakalpa Organic, in conversation with Sridhar Pabbisetty, Mentor in Residence at NSRCEL was hosted where the speakers delved into the realities of building a values-driven business that scales. 

From navigating the challenges of rural entrepreneurship to driving innovation in sustainable farming, this conversation highlighted lessons from the ground on scaling purpose-driven ventures. The discussion offered deep insights into building and growing social enterprises while staying rooted in mission, values, and real-world impact.
Following the conversation, the Impact Mixer brought together early-stage social entrepreneurs, mentors, and ecosystem enablers for an evening of connection and community. 

Chitvan Chamadia Atlanta Madhukalya Rameez Roshan Shivam Punjabi Manika Gulati Sehar Kaur
#NSRCEL #ImpactOrbit  #SocialEntrepreneurship #FiresideChat #Akshayakalpa #ScalingWithPurpose #SustainableInnovation #StartupEcosystem #SocialImpactStartups

üöÄ Cohort 6 Bootcamp Kickoff ‚Äì Impact Orbit- Tech-Enabled Social Innovations
 Last week, 23 early-stage startups incubated as a part of Impact Orbit- Tech-Enabled Social Innovations, an initiative by Capgemini in partnership with NSRCEL, working across education, skill development, livelihoods, women‚Äôs health, mental health, and impact services came together for a 3-day bootcamp.

From refining their Theory of Change and sharpening their communication and pitching, to deep dives into organizational development and leadership, the bootcamp was packed with learning.

Startups had the opportunity to interact with the founder of Meraki, engage with the Capgemini leadership team, and build meaningful connections with mentors, peers, and the NSRCEL team.

This is just the beginning, here‚Äôs to building impact-driven ventures with clarity, community, and purpose. üå±

üìä Thank You, Dr. Raghunandan NK! üí°

üôè We at DERBI Foundation extend our sincere appreciation to Dr. Raghunandan N K for conducting a high-impact workshop on the Business Model Canvas (BMC) for our startup cohort.

üï¥ The session offered deep insights into how startups can move beyond traditional business planning to embrace flexible, iterative, and value-driven models. 

ü™û From refining the value proposition and customer segmentation to mapping key metrics, pricing strategies, and leveraging unfair advantages, the workshop equipped our founders with practical tools to build, test, and evolve their models.

Key highlights included:
 ‚úÖ Understanding the BMC framework and its adaptability
 ‚úÖ The Build-Measure-Learn loop in validating startup assumptions
 ‚úÖ Identifying customer pain points and market demand
 ‚úÖ Real-life examples that grounded theory in startup reality

Thank you, Dr. Raghunandan, for empowering our startups with the clarity and structure needed to navigate their growth with confidence and strategy!

Sathyanarayana B V | Bhavani G | Dr. Adithya Hande | Daamini Sharma | MeitY Startup Hub | Pankaj Anand | Startup Karnataka | Karnataka Digital Economy Mission (KDEM) |

As India‚Äôs agriculture sector grapples with climate uncertainty, water stress, and rising input costs, the need for resilient, scalable innovations has never been more urgent.¬† 

Krishi Mangal, an initiative by Social Alpha and Cisco CSR, is looking for start-ups working to shape the future of agriculture. 

Now in its third edition, Krishi Mangal invites applications from start-ups developing affordable, scalable, and field-validated technologies that strengthen India‚Äôs agricultural resilience.¬† 

The program is open to innovations solving for Integrated Farming Management, Soil Rejuvenation and Irrigation Management, Farm Mechanisation, Post-Harvest Management, and Livestock Waste Management.¬† 

Applications close on 13th July 2025.¬†Apply now: https://lnkd.in/gNwjafu8

Sustain Plus | Manoj Kumar | Ganesh Neelam | Cisco | Harish Krishnan | Rohini Kamath | Tarun Anthony

#FarmingForward #SocialAlpha #CiscoCSR #DeepTechForAgriculture #FarmersDeserveDeepTech

India‚Äôs livestock sector is growing‚Äîbut so is the waste it generates. 

Inadequate waste management leads to methane emissions, groundwater contamination, and health risks for farm-adjacent and farming communities.¬†
At the same time, this waste stream holds untapped value‚Äîfrom clean energy to soil health to circular inputs for agriculture. 

We‚Äôre inviting start-ups using AI/ML and IoT in developing solutions that: 

- Transform livestock waste into biogas, biofertilisers, or organic inputs¬†
- Build decentralised, efficient processing systems¬†
- Reduce handling complexity and make adoption feasible for small farmers¬†
- Enable climate-positive, income-generating uses of dairy or poultry waste 

Solutions should be scalable, sustainable, and relevant to low-resource rural or peri-urban contexts. 

Selected start-ups will receive funding, lab and prototyping support, incubation, expert mentorship, and access to implementation and capital partners. 

Applications close on 13th July 2025.¬†Apply now: https://lnkd.in/gNwjafu8

Sustain Plus | Manoj Kumar | Ganesh Neelam | Cisco | Harish Krishnan | Rohini Kamath | Tarun Anthony

#FarmingForward #LivestockWasteInnovation #CircularEconomy #SocialAlpha #CiscoCSR #DeepTechForAgriculture

Led by Manish Jaiswal, Deshpande Startups is one of India‚Äôs largest livelihood-focused incubators ‚Äî proving that world-class startups can rise from tier-2 India.

Venture Center was delighted to be part of the Royal Academy of Engineering‚Äôs Leadership in Innovation Fellowship (LIF) 2025 In-country Partner Training Program held in London from 6‚Äì11 July.

Pranoti Kulkarni represented Venture Center at this multi-day event that brought together in-country partners and over 70 innovators from across Asia, Africa, and Latin America. The program featured expert-led sessions on innovation policy, commercialization, sustainability, and scaling up. While there, Pranoti also had the chance to visit leading institutions such as Cambridge Cleantech and InnovationRCA, engaging with founders and innovation leaders. 

The event concluded with a high-energy pitch day. We‚Äôre proud to share that Module Innovations, a Venture Center-supported startup, was the winner of the prestigious Pitch Award at the Royal Academy of Engineering Leaders in Innovation‚ÄìGlobal 2025 Pitch Day, representing India among 70 innovators and startups from 9 countries.

Venture Center is proud to support innovation-driven entrepreneurship in partnership with global ecosystems like LIF and the Royal Academy of Engineering. Thank You for the opportunity.

üö® Startup Tip No. 2: Validate before you build

Got an app idea? A new product in mind?

Pause.

Before building anything, talk to 50 people.
‚úì Understand their problems
‚úì Learn how they currently solve it
‚úì Ask if they'd pay for your solution

Your first milestone isn‚Äôt a prototype; it‚Äôs real conversations.

At VentureStudio, too many founders skip this step and build in the dark.

Validation saves you months of rework and regret.

Talk first. Build later.

#StartupTips #ValidateBeforeYouBuild #EarlyStageStartups #ProductValidation #CustomerDiscovery #VentureStudio #BuildSmart #StartupAdvice #FounderJourney

As part of the #ProtoQuik Launchpad Cohort - 1, Dr. Raashid Saiyed, Resident Business Mentor at iCreate, conducted a high-impact think session on makings of a relavant startup.

The session covered the need to pursue a demand led -high CONU (cost of not using) innovation, how successful founders zeroed down on the right pain point to pursue and the macro environmental factors which make a startup relevant. Inter alia the session served as a reality check for the budding founders with stars in the eyes and traced the paths taken by a couple billionaires.

iCreate was proud to be an ecosystem partner at #SusCrunch2025, where the bold Climate Sitdown series set a new benchmark for honest, human-first climate dialogue. No panels. No filters. Just purpose-driven voices speaking from the heart.

Representing iCreate at the event were Dr.Praveen D., Head ‚Äì TBI, and Mr. Divyalax Chauhan, Technology Analyst, who engaged with innovators, investors, and changemakers building for climate impact.
The energy was raw, the insights were deep, and the intent was clear ‚Äî it‚Äôs time to move #FromTalkToAction.

Kudos to the SusCrunch team for curating a space that champions vulnerability, clarity, and courage in the climate conversation. We‚Äôre excited for what comes next! üí¨üå±

India continues to lead from the front in the global startup policy arena!

We are proud to announce India‚Äôs representation across all Task Forces of the Startup20 Engagement Group under the G20 South Africa Presidency. Building on the success of India‚Äôs leadership during the 2023 Presidency, Indian stakeholders are actively shaping global policy frameworks to empower startups worldwide.

üåç Startup20 ‚Äì G20‚Äôs official engagement group for startups ‚Äì provides a global platform to connect innovators with policymakers, driving inclusive growth through entrepreneurship.

ü§ù The collaborative spirit continues as India contributes to global startup policymaking under the G20 South Africa Presidency, with key representatives across all task forces:
üëâ Foundation & Alliances - Startup Policy Forum (Lead), Atal Innovation Mission Official  (Co-Lead)¬†
üëâ Inclusion & Sustainability - iCreate (Lead), FICCI (Co-Lead)
üëâ Finance & Investment - Biotechnology Industry Research Assistance Council (BIRAC) (Lead), Confederation of Indian Industry (Co-Lead)
üëâ Trade & Market Access - Indian STEPs and Business Incubators Association (ISBA)(Lead), MeitY Startup Hub (Co-Lead)
üëâ Township & Rural Entrepreneurship - nasscom startups (Lead), National Innovation Foundation - India (DST-NIF) (Co-Lead)

üìå Dr. Chintan Vaishnav leads the Indian delegation with strong support from Startup India and the Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade under the Ministry of Commerce and Industry, Government of India.
As Startup20 gains momentum under the G20 South Africa Presidency, India remains at the heart of this global movement.
